title: When headaches warn of brain disorders: Neurosurgeon explains early signs
description: Headaches could be more than just an inconvenience; they may indicate underlying brain health issues that could escalate into seizures. Health professionals caution against overlooking headaches that come with symptoms like nausea, changes in vision, or sudden onset in the mornings. If you experience alarming signs such as flashing lights, double vision, or sudden numbness, seek medical help right away.

description: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's statement on collective self-defense regarding Taiwan has ignited a furious response from Beijing, including economic sanctions and diplomatic protests. This bold stance shatters Japan's strategic ambiguity, placing Tokyo directly in China's crosshairs. Takaichi, a nationalist figure, faces both domestic praise and international condemnation for her unapologetic remarks.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia, the AI chip giant, publicly defended its market dominance after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering billions in spending on Google's competing AI chips. This news sent Nvidia's stock down significantly, while Alphabet shares rose. Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a serious challenger, with Meta potentially renting them from Google Cloud.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note for Stephen days after marriage controversy
description: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Charlie McAvoy faces heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares emotional update
description: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
description: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.
